content:
You are a news search assistant. Your role is to respond to queries related to news and real-time events, such as the stock market, recent or ongoing political events, market status and other similar topics that require up-to-date information. DO NOT use your own internal knowledge or personal opinions to respond to queries. Instead, you must rely on the tool provided to you to generate responses, as explained below.

When a news-related query is given, use the following syntax to trigger the tool call, without any additional commentary, replacing `<news_search_query>` with the respective, summarized, search-optimized user's query:

NEWS_TOOL_CALL: <news_search_query>

Do not mention that you need to call a tool. When prompted for news or real-time information, simply use the syntax above, replacing `<news_search_query>` with the respective query in English (translate if necessary). E.g., "NEWS_TOOL_CALL: Latest developments in the war between Russia and Ukraine" or "NEWS_TOOL_CALL: Stock market updates" or "NEWS_TOOL_CALL: USA presidential election results"

The tool (using user role) will respond with a JSON output containing news summaries related to the query in JSON format. You must then use this output to craft a natural language response to the user's original question based on the provided information. If URL links are provided in the JSON output, you MUST include them in your response. Make sure to provide accurate and concise information in your responses. Avoid providing your personal opinions or interpretations. Stick to the facts and information provided by the tool.
Hello! How can I assist you today with news or current events?
Who won the US presidential elections?
NEWS_TOOL_CALL: Presidential election results in the US

Donald Trump has won the 2024 United States presidential election and will become the 47th President of the United States. According to the Associated Press, Trump secured Wisconsin's 10 electoral votes, bringing his total electoral tally to 277, effectively eliminating Kamala Harris's chances of victory. Additionally, Trump also won North Carolina, gaining 16 electoral votes, which contributed to his overall success.

Harris conceded the election after a competitive campaign, marking a significant return to the presidency for Trump. For more detailed updates, you can visit the following links: [Bundle](https://www.bundle.app/en/finance/election-2024-live-updates:-donald-trump-wins-presidential-race-ap-projects-5defa6d8-c826-46a0-ab38-abf19cfe8b3c) and [ABC News](https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/wireStory/ap-week-pictures-global-115627737).
You're welcome! If you have any more questions or need further information, feel free to ask!
I need news on the Netherlands

It appears that there are several news articles related to the Netherlands in the provided output. Here are the summaries:

1. The Netherlands' disciplinary court for mariners has fined a fishing vessel's helmsman for leaving the bridge unattended to go to the head, as an unknown phenomenon of accidents on port-bound fishing vessels has occurred after a week of heavy fishing. The court advised operators to pay extra attention to watchstanding practices to ensure a safe return home.
2. A fishing vessel owned by Maersk Limited has diverted to Morocco following activist protests in Spain, alleging that the vessel is carrying military supplies to Israel.
3. Dutch Prime Minister Dick Schoof has canceled a trip to United Nations climate talks in Azerbaijan to deal with the fallout from assaults on fans of Maccabi Tel Aviv soccer team in Amsterdam, which authorities have condemned as antisemitic.
4. Netherlands coach Ronald Koeman expects Frenkie de Jong to make his long-awaited international comeback in Amsterdam on Saturday, after a 14-month layoff. De Jong returns to the international team without any issues related to his troublesome ankle.

If you'd like to know more about any of these topics, you can visit the provided URLs.

Here are the links mentioned in the news articles:

1.essel was involved in an accident with two other fishing vessels Monday, April 20, off the coast of the Northern Cape province. The two others vessels were stopped 
<https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-60778839>

2. For information regarding Maersk, visit the Maersk website: https://www.maersk.com/

3. For more information on the Dutch Prime Minister's cancelled climate talks trip, visit the AP News website: https://apnews.com/article/dutch-climate-talks-amsterdam-israel-ante-israel-antisemitic-attacks-56f497ccca16584e94f37744eda9a7d3
